text: - We at Resolution Life use grows
as by mergers and acquisitions.

When we acquire a company, we
get, in addition to people,
process, technology, we get a lot of data

and that data is typically
about customers and policy.

We partner with AWS and
also our SI partners
to come up with the solution approach
to pivot to AWS native service.

I think the few key
notable ones was built out

of a data lake using a
Lakehouse Architecture

which is our primary data
repository for customer data,
policy data, and even financial data.

And then we build a policy
customer transaction database

called Operational
DataHub on AWS platform.

When customer logs on to
our digital properties,

they're able to see all of that
information at single place

and then they're able
to perform any action.
If they want to do an address change,

or they want to change a
beneficiary on a policy,

or a YouTube product, they
can all do it at single place.
It's all single point and click,
pretty much like add to order for Amazon.

So we're trying to give
that kind of an experience,

like a single-click
experience to customer.
(bright music)
